result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian P. Hermanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school.

Counseling
Complete Mental Health assessment. 
Take all prescription medications as prescribed.
Gun ordered to be forfeited.
1 day credit if revoked.
Eligible for early discharge from probation after 6 months.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian P. Hermanson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 11:16am. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears prose. Crt advises defendant rights to counsel. Waiver of Rights & Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed*.  VRCW*  PLEA: NO CONTEST - ct 1 (dc/repeater/use of dangerous weapon). COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  def is competent to represent self: a factual basis & def guilty. Statements made by State; Defendant; E.L. owner of Elm.  COURT ORDERS: SWH - 1 yr probation. CONDITIONS: Counseling; Complete Mental Health Assessment; No dangerous weapons; Gun ordered to be forfeited; take all prescription medications as prescribed; Good faith effort to obtain and maintin fulltime employment and/or school; 20 hrs Community Service; Court Costs; DNA Surcharge. Credit of 1 day in the event of revocation. Eligible to apply for early discharge from probation after 6 months.  Adj: 11:43am.
Plea hearing on July 20, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Plea hearing on June 3, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Case Called: 11:13 a.m. 
Defendant appears in person. 
Court questions defendant re: Employment & Income. 
Court denies appointment of counsel, defendant not indigent. 
Adj:11:14 a.m. 
C: Br. 1

Indigency hearing on March 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 23, 2015 at 02:50 pm.
Final pre-trial on May 19, 2015 at 09:55 am.
Jury Trial on May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.   No contact with victim(s): ELM Repair or employees. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Take meds as prescribed. Gun involved must be turned over to the Sheriff's dept within 24 hurs of release.
